article_node.title: Review: 'Long Story Short' is a moving tale of a modern Jewish American family
article_node.summary: The Netflix animated series "Long Story Short" follows a middle-class Jewish family through the 1990s to the 2020s, exploring themes of family dynamics, the passage of time, and cultural identity. Created by Raphael Bob-Waksberg and designed by Lisa Hanawalt, the show features vibrant, whimsical animation and tells individual stories within each episode while addressing broader societal issues, including the challenges faced by Jewish families in contemporary America. The series highlights the complexities of relationships and the impact of cultural heritage on personal identity.
